DOC.brief_summary: Temporary stomas has been performed to reduce complications after colorectal cancer surgery, especially in high-risk anastomosis. Different closure technics showed different outcome. The aim of this study is to compare the VSS score , surgical site infection and pain score of pursestring wound closure vs conventional closure.
DOC.brief_title: Study Comparing Pursestring Wound Closure vs Conventional Closure to Reverse Stoma of Colorectal Cancer Patients
DOC.criteria: Receiving temporary ostomy because of colorectal cancer at least 3 months ago; Age of≥18 and ≤80 Not willing or incapable to comply with all study visits and assessments Evidence of any other disease, metabolic dysfunction, physical examination finding or laboratory finding giving reasonable suspicion of a disease or condition that puts the patient at high risk for treatmentrelated complications
